text.text:
ITC Royal Bengal is a testament to luxury and grandeur, offering an experience that is both opulent and memorable. From the moment you step in, the hotel exudes a sense of lavishness, with its exquisite décor and magnificent ambiance. It stands as a shining example of luxury hospitality.

The banquets at ITC Royal Bengal are particularly impressive. They boast superb space, making them ideal for hosting grand events or intimate gatherings. The attention to detail in the design and layout of these banquet halls adds to their lavishness, ensuring that every event feels special and well-catered for.

Additionally, the service at ITC Royal Bengal is impeccable. The staff go above and beyond to ensure guests feel valued and taken care of, adding to the overall luxurious experience.

In summary, ITC Royal Bengal stands out as a premier destination for those seeking luxury and grandeur in Kolkata. Whether you are staying as a guest or attending an event in their banquet halls, the experience is bound to be extraordinary.

text.text:
5 stars ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ for the resort.
3 stars ⭐⭐⭐ for the water park.
Overall 4/5.
The water park's management is pathetic there's broken tiles, found bird poop stuck on one of the water slides. Nicco park's wet-o-wild is way better. They don't clean the pools very often so you'll find dead insects in the pool. Don't expect warm water in winter (like wet-o-wild).
Room in the resort was awesome. Nice view, clean washroom, had a mini refrigerator and electric kettle and everything. Moderately soundproof as well.

text.text:
A Luxurious Retreat: The Park Hotel

My recent stay at The Park Hotel was an absolute delight! From the moment I entered, the ambiance exuded elegance and sophistication. The staff's warm welcome and attentive service made me feel instantly at home.

The room was impeccably clean, well-appointed, and offered breathtaking views of the surrounding cityscape. The comfortable bedding ensured a restful sleep, while the modern amenities provided convenience and comfort throughout my stay.

Dining at The Park Hotel was a culinary journey in itself. The diverse range of cuisines served at their restaurants tantalized my taste buds, and the attention to detail in presentation and taste was commendable. Moreover, the staff's knowledge and recommendations elevated the dining experience.

The hotel's facilities, including the gym and spa, were top-notch, allowing me to relax and rejuvenate after a long day of exploring the city.

What truly stood out, however, was the impeccable service. The staff members were not only professional but also personable, always ready to assist with a smile, making my stay memorable and delightful.

Overall, The Park Hotel exceeded my expectations in every aspect. It's a haven of luxury, comfort, and outstanding hospitality. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a truly exceptional experience.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Park Hotel and can't stop raving about the wonderful experience. From the moment I stepped into the elegant lobby, I knew I was in for a treat.

The staff at The Park Hotel went above and beyond to make my stay memorable. The service was impeccable, with every team member exuding warmth and professionalism. They were always ready to assist with a genuine smile, making me feel welcomed and valued as a guest.

The room was a haven of comfort and style. It was impeccably clean, well-appointed, and boasted breathtaking views. The attention to detail in the room's design and amenities truly set The Park Hotel apart. The comfortable bed, luxurious linens, and well-stocked minibar made it difficult to leave the room!

One of the highlights of my stay was the dining experience. The hotel's restaurant offered a diverse and delicious menu, with each dish expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The breakfast buffet was a particular standout, offering a wide array of fresh, high-quality options to suit every palate.

In conclusion, The Park Hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I wholeheartedly recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a luxurious and memorable stay. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

text.text: I’ve been going to the Park for decades- since tantra opened. Their nightclubs are pretty good especially the ladies night in Roxy. However , their banquet service for a wedding reception was quite unprofessional in terms of the servers attitude. Once the event was coming to an end one of the waiters approached us asking whether we tipped and asked HOW MUCH. When my father said he paid a lump sum to be divided amongst them all , ALL the waiters just left the guests and went to count the money. This is really sub par pathetic service.

text.text: My experience at the JW Marriott was beyond anything I have experienced anywhere else in the world. The customer service, amenities, and food were unmatched. The hotel itself is beautiful and view from the room and pool are breathtaking. I was happy to stay here for my first visit to India - I have never felt more welcomed anywhere in my life. The staff are so kind and accommodating to foreigners (and anyone for that matter). I would highly recommend this hotel for those unfamiliar with the area or culture. While I expect nobody at the hotel who interacted with me will see this review I would like to say thank you again for your hospitality - you have truly made my trip so wonderful. I hope to come back soon.

text.text:
Let me cut to the chase - STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROPERTY DURING ANY TIME THERE’S A PARTY ( holidays/weekends) IF YOU WANT TO GET SLEEP DUE TO THE LOUD MUSIC

We stayed there during New Years and there were parties at the hotel club on Dec 30 and Dec 31.  My entire room was vibrating from the loud music blasted from the club.

The event was scheduled to stop at 4am.
The first night it ended at 4am, the second night music was still blasting at 4:30am.  When I called to speak with concierge to make a noise complaint, I was told the music was off.  Clearly it was not because my room was still vibrating and I would have never called in the first place. The receptionist told me she would look into it. I called back at 4:40am because the music was still on, and asked to speak with the manager. The manager yet again told me the music was off when it wasn’t.  I went downstairs to speak to the manager directly because clearly my concerns were not being addressed. Both times they lied and told me the music was off and tried to gaslight me. Both the receptionist and manager refused to do anything until I said I’m not leaving here until the music is off as the music was supposed to stop at 4am. I get that it’s New Years Eve and people want to party. But this was almost 5am.

We are paying to stay at a 5 star hotel, not a club. You should implement a strict end time as most other countries do. Or if you want to play music all night long, then you should consider investing in some soundproof walls.

The way the situation was handled was soo unprofessional and I expect way better from a 5 star hotel.

Besides that huge downfall, the rooms were spacious and clean. Large breakfast spread. Gym equipment were new and functional.

text.text:
"I recently had the pleasure of staying at your hotel and I must say it was a pleasant experience.

The room I stayed in was quite comfortable. It was clean and well-maintained, providing a cozy and welcoming ambiance. The furnishings were modern and stylish, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. The room offered all the necessary amenities, such as a flat-screen TV, a minibar, and a spacious en-suite bathroom.

One of the standout aspects of my stay was the hotel's exceptional staff. They were not only courteous but also very helpful and accommodating. From check-in to check-out, they went out of their way to make sure my needs and preferences were met. Whether it was a special request or general inquiries about the area, they were always ready to assist with a smile.

While my stay was generally pleasant, I would have appreciated a more varied dining menu at the on-site restaurant. The options were somewhat limited, and as someone who enjoys exploring local cuisine, this was a minor drawback. However, the staff's attentiveness and willingness to provide recommendations helped make up for it.

In summary, my stay at was a positive one. The room's comfort and the exceptional service from the staff left a lasting impression. It's an excellent choice for travelers seeking a convenient and welcoming place to stay. I would recommend it, and I would certainly consider returning in the future."

I was shocked to see that 5star hotel doesn't provide you with Hand wash😞
The food and laundry rates are very high which is not worth value for money.
Hospitality is good.
The bathroom doesn't have exhaust fans, so when you take shower be ready to see the small pond near your legs and the heavy AMT of fog in entire bathroom.
Further, the washbasin doesn't have hot water tap.
So overall, I can't say this is 5star hotel.
But, if you are looking for great location then you can try..

text.text:
The Vivanta Hotel in Kolkata impressed me from the moment I stepped inside. The view was awesome, and the staff was incredibly attentive. The food was the highlight of the experience, especially the starters and desserts. They were bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. While the main course was good, it couldn't quite match the starters and desserts. Overall, it was a wonderful experience for both our corporate program and family dinner.
I would highly recommend the Vivanta Hotel to anyone looking for a stylish and delicious experience in Kolkata.

text.text:
For 13k a night for a basic room, the experience was pretty bad. The lifts are slow, and the access card keeps blocking at least twice a day. The property doesn't have a kid's play area or a lawn, so it's not kid-friendly. The indoor pool is not heated.  It's like a small 3-star hotel. When checking out I had to call three times and wait for around 25 minutes before someone arrived with a trolley to carry our luggage downstairs. Then I had to wait for another 10 minutes at the reception because someone was arguing that they didn't get the room after the reservation. Could have missed my flight because of this.

Avoid this property especially if you staying with kids.

I read other reviews and expect the same copy/paste response which is not even relevant to many issues... Pasting it here before their robot does it!

Thank you very much for choosing to stay at Vivanta Kolkata EM Bypass and taking your valuable time out to share your experiences with us. It is most disheartening to receive feedback such as yours. The comfort and needs of our guests.... blah blah blah.

text.text:
I recently booked a deluxe room at Taj City Center Newtown Kolkata for January 31 and February 1, 2024, and made an advance payment, trusting the renowned reputation of the Taj group in the hospitality industry. However, my experience was far from satisfactory.

Despite requesting airport pickup and making the necessary arrangements, no one showed up. After waiting for half an hour, I had to arrange my own taxi to the hotel. Upon reaching the hotel and expressing my disappointment at the front desk, there was no satisfactory response or resolution.

This lack of adherence to a basic service request and the unresponsiveness of the hotel staff left me deeply disappointed. I expected a higher standard of service from a brand as esteemed as the Taj group.

I hope this feedback serves as an opportunity for improvement and that future guests do not encounter similar inconveniences. The essence of hospitality lies in the details, and unfortunately, my experience fell short of the standards set by the Taj group.

text.text:
Not a Taj experience at all.
Room was small, though very clean and comfortable. Bed was excellent.
Breakfast was small, and 95 percent same on both the days.
None of the staffs smile at you, a very robotic experience which is unlike of Taj. One goes to Taj not for just a clean room, but for the hospitality. That's missing here.
Location is near the airport and right next to City Centre 2, but that's all. Not very convenient if you have to go to the city for work.
Overall, there are better or equally good options available in the city.

text.text:
This hotel is close to the airport so very handy if you're taking flights to other places from Kolkata (we were going to and from Darjeeling). I would recommend you get the hotel to organize your transfer from the airport -- their Innova is clean and the drivers are so helpful. We stayed at the Taj Newtown for a total of 6 nights. We loved it!

Every single member of staff is helpful, respectful and friendly, and speaks fluent English. The hotel is super clean, the rooms are huge, the beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms are spacious and hygienic. Everything you could want is available -- even your own iron and ironing board in your room. There is a lovely outdoor pool and a great gym -- both of which my kids found were perfect.

The buffet breakfast and dinner were AMAZING, so much variety, so many delicious dishes, also you can order extras like pizza and barbecued sizzlers and all kinds of roti. The cakes and deserts are unbelievable! We met the Sous Chef, Bhubaneswar Chatterjee to thank him for the gorgeous patisserie -- he had trained abroad in some grand restaurants which  explained the high standard. The restaurant is beautifully and efficiently run. We also met with Sujit Dey, a head chef, who was kind enough to make some special Bengali dishes for my children, and he discussed his recipes and gave me some great cooking tips. He was also kind enough to provide a packed lunch for us on the day we checked out because we had a long wait for our flight back to the UK. Really, the care and friendliness of the staff made us feel so special and welcome.

The surrounding area of Newtown is very impressive, a real regeneration project for Kolkata. There is a wonderful luxury Indian sweets centre opposite the hotel, a modern shopping mall right next door, and a Westside clothing department store (second floor for lovely Indian styles) within walking distance. Newtown is a bit far from the centre of the city, but we will definitely stay at this Taj again!

text.text:
Title: Unpleasant Experience Due to Noise Disturbance

Review:

I recently stayed at Zone By The Park in Kolkata (Room No. 520), and unfortunately, my experience was marred by a significant issue. At 2:00 am, I was disturbed by loud party music coming from the 10th floor. Despite my immediate complaint to the reception, no action was taken to address the noise.

This lack of responsiveness to a guest's concern is disheartening. A hotel should prioritize the comfort of its guests, especially during late hours. The disturbance affected my sleep and overall satisfaction with the stay.

I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and implements measures to prevent such incidents in the future. Guests should be able to expect a peaceful and comfortable stay, and unfortunately, my experience fell short of that expectation.

Vikrant Gupta
